Message.Title: iPad Mini vs Google Nexus 7
Message.Msg: Alright folks, I believe that you may be already familiar with the specs, but just in case you’re not, let’s make a quick recap. The Google Nexus 7 comes with a 7-inch screen supporting a resolution of 1280 x 800 and a pixel density of 216 ppi. It also arrives with an Nvidia Tegra 3 quad-core processor running at 1.3 GHz, 1 GB of RAM, it’s currently available with 16 GB of storage and you can also pre-order the 32 GB model on the Google Play Store, it packs Android 4.1 Jelly Bean out of the box and a 4,325 mAh battery. The iPad Mini on the other hand comes with a slightly larger 7.9-inch screen, a resolution of 1024 x 768, a pixel density of 162 ppi, a dual core A5 CPU clocked at 1 GHz, 512 MB of RAM and 16/32/64 options of storage. It also arrives with a 5 MP camera on the back, a feature that is missing from the Nexus 7. Clearly and undeniably, the iPad Mini has inferior hardware in almost every aspect, but as we’ve said before, that wouldn’t be a problem if the price would’ve been set accordingly. Unfortunately the “entry-level” Mini costs more than a Nexus 7 by quite a lot, so it will set you back $329. Spec and price-wise, the Mini doesn’t stand a chance against Google’s tablet, but it might take the cake in terms of build quality and design, right? Well, not necessarily. Yes, the Mini is very, very thin and it comes with a nice aluminum case, but Google’s 7-incher comes with a more convenient form factor and the rubbery material used in constructing the case feels very good in the hands. It also comes with a thicker bezel, which might sound like a disadvantage but most of the time it isn’t, simply because with the iPad Mini and its thin bezel, your hands will oftentimes cover up a portion of the screen. In any case, we think that the Nexus 7 wins the battle hands down, but if you wish to see them both side-by side, feel free to check out the video below. Source: gforgamesDOTcom/gadgets/ipad-mini-vs-google-nexus-7-video-battle-27341/

Topic.Title: FTC Staff Said to Formally Recommend Suing Google for Antitrust

Message.Msg: "After the U.S. Federal Trade Commissions sues Google, and a judge finds them guilty of their bad antitrust behavior, and their aggrieved and damaged competitors Apple, Microsoft, Oracle et al. received Trebled damages from Google -- that android operating system isn't likely to be free anymore, right Best?. Google will have to charge for it. A lot." So Best? Any idea how much Google will need to charge for the android os? Maybe a Hundred Dollars ($100.00) per device, like Microsoft, right?

Topic.Title: Ipad MIni sales appears to be underwhelming.....

Message.Msg: Sales of the Genuine Apple Mini have blown the doors off that tegra-powered Nexus 7. In just Two (2) days on the market, mind you. Witnesseth the Truth for yourself, boys. Google this : Apple expected to ship 850K iPad minis in first week of sales Apple Insider Apple expected to ship 850K iPad minis in first week of sales Friday, November 02, 2012, 07:56 pm By Mikey Campbell As the first iPad mini preorders are being delivered and the tablet hits shelves at brick-and-mortar retailers, shipment forecasts are already being released, with one analyst estimating a total of 850,000 units will go out to consumers over the device's first week of sales. In a report obtained by AppleInsider, well-informed KGI analyst Ming-Chi Kuo said Apple will likely ship around 850,000 iPad minis in its first week on the market, based on supply chain checks and logistical considerations such as transportation. Kuo believes that had mass production started sooner than mid-October, the tablet would have seen higher first-week shipments. As it stands, Apple is in short supply of the 7.9-inch device as about 950,000 units were manufactured prior to launch, a statistic reflected in shipment quotes from the Online Apple Store. The analyst goes on to say his forecast would put Apple at the top of the mid-size tablet market, with shipments outperforming Amazon's Kindle Fire HD and Google Nexus 7, two of the mini's biggest competitors. In the first two days after launch, iPad mini shipments are expected to reach the Fire's half-month shipment numbers and surpass the Nexus 7's average monthly shipments for the fourth quarter. Amazon forecast shipments of its 7-inch tablet to hit 6 million in the fourth quarter, but Kuo doesn't believe will happen. He said that suppliers are beginning to see a slowdown in shipment momentum for the Fire, as well as the Nexus 7, and added that the larger 8.9-inch Kindle Fire HD is now suffering from production problems. Kuo sees lucrative holiday quarter shipments at 8.2 million for the iPad mini, followed by 4.5 million for the Kindle Fire HD, and 1.9 million for the Nexus 7. Going further, the Fire and Nexus will both see respective month-to-month declines of 47 percent and 52 percent, while iPad mini shipments will grow 11 percent over the same period due to increases in supply. After selling out of its initial preorder allotment within hours, Apple conducted its largest product launch ever on Friday as the iPad mini rolled out in 34 countries. Though Amazon's forecast is more than the chart (6M for 4Q12), very likely Amazon can't do it. Many suppliers are feeling the shipment momentum of Kindle Fire HD and Nexus 7 is becoming slow. The other not good news for Amazon is the 8.9" Kindle Fire HD has production problem now." .

Topic.Title: Ipad MIni sales appears to be underwhelming.....

Message.Msg: For NVDA's sake, I'd actually hope that the iPad Mini would draw a lot of attention and bring a lot more folks into the big retailers that are offering both the iPad Mini and the Nexus 7. It'd give the Nexus 7 more exposure to a broader demographic and force a comparison based on functionality and value. I imagine the net result would/will be an increasing number of people going into stores thinking they want to buy a 16GB iPad Mini for $329, but instead buying a 16GB Nexus 7 for $199. Or a 32GB Nexus 7 with 3G for $299, getting twice the storage PLUS wireless connectivity while still saving $30 over the cheapest wi-fi only Mini.

Topic.Title: Ipad MIni sales appears to be underwhelming.....

Message.Msg: Be sure to check out that chart from KGI Research, boys. Google this : Apple expected to ship 850K iPad minis in first week of sales Apple Insider My my my. Sales of the Nexus 7 are anticipated to Precipitously Plunge in December. Could be the End of the Road for that tegra-powered tablet.

Message.Msg: It's now $299 for a 32GB Nexus 7 equipped with HSPA+ wireless connectivity... compared to $329 for the 16GB WiFi-only iPad Mini for $329. The value proposition seems clear... even clearer if you're an Android phone user.

Topic.Title: Ipad MIni sales appears to be underwhelming.....

Message.Msg: I just disagree that it's a zero sum game. I root for the Mini to increase interest and awareness in the smaller 7" form factor. Asustek's own comments put the Nexus 7 sales at around 2.1-2.3M for their FY'Q3. AAPL doing 1M+ the first week is good, and it'll probably sell more units than the N7 by year's end. But that's fine. The Mini doesn't have to fail for the N7 or Nvidia to do well.

Topic.Title: Ipad MIni sales appears to be underwhelming.....

Message.Msg: KGI Research? Had you ever heard of them before this? Nexus 7 precipitously plunging in December would be pretty surprising considering that Asustek recently confirmed that monthly unit sales have been steadily growing, month after month, with October the strongest month so far. Now you have the 16GB for $199, the 32GB for $249, and the 32GB with cellular connectivity for $299 -- all brand new pricing/features for the holiday season with an improved value proposition. I'd bet November and December average 1.5M units sold or more (a 50% increase from October).

Message.Title: AnandTech : Apple's new A6X processor gives the tegra 3 a Spanking.
Message.Msg: Speechless, boys. Take a look at the AnandTech benchmarks -- the gold standard for benchmarks, of the Apple self-designed A6X processor versus the pitifully pathetic tegra 3. Google it boys : iPad 4 GPU Performance Analyzed: PowerVR SGX 554MP4 Under the Hood Good luck competing with that Genuine Apple A6X processor, boys. "Ultimately it looks like the A6X is the SoC that the iPad needed to really deliver good gaming performance at its native resolution. I would not be surprised to see more game developers default to 2048 x 1536 on the new iPad rather than picking a lower resolution and enabling anti-aliasing. The bar has been set for this generation and we've seen what ARM's latest GPU can do." Now the question is whether or not NVIDIA will finally be able to challenge Imagination Technologies clearly superior graphics -- or call it quits next year.

Topic.Title: AnandTech : Apple's new A6X processor gives the tegra 3 a Spanking.

Message.Msg: A6X is only available to Apple. Their SoCs performing better puts pressure on all other mobile device makers to spend more money on SoCs with bigger GPUs and more overall power. This is *good* for Nvidia in the medium to long term. The Tegra 3+ in the HTC One X+ already has a bigger/more powerful GPU than the lower-bin T3s and Tegra 4 is rumored to set for a debut at CES in January, with an even beefier GPU.

Topic.Title: AnandTech : Apple's new A6X processor gives the tegra 3 a Spanking.

Message.Msg: "Tegra 4 is rumored...." That's it? That's ALL nvidia's got? More "rumors" of this and that -- someday. Look. Apple is shipping tablets TODAY with Four Times (4x) the horsepower of the dying Tegra 3. So how is an OEM tablet customer of nvidia going to compete with Apple's superior A6X processor, using today's nvidia tegra parts? Hummm? IT'S NOT GONNA HAPPEN. Apple is so far ahead of nvidia now, all that's left to do is for Jen's replacement to take the Enormous Tegra Chargeoff.

Topic.Title: AnandTech : Apple's new A6X processor gives the tegra 3 a Spanking.

Message.Msg: "So how is an OEM tablet customer of nvidia going to compete with Apple's superior A6X processor, using today's nvidia tegra parts? Hummm?" Exactly my point. They're going to have to buy Nvidia's *future* Tegra parts in order to compete. Qualcomm et al relying on either Imagination Technologies or ARM's Mali GPU cores won't be enough... they'll need SoCs with Kepler cores.

Topic.Title: iPad Mini vs Google Nexus 7

Message.Msg: Perhaps you boys missed the AnandTech benchmark comparison tests? Of the new Apple A6X processor versus the pitifully pathetic nvidia tegra 3. Short story : Apple's new A6X-powered iPad 4 tablet has FOUR TIMES (4x) the horsepower of the tegra-powered Nexus 7 tablet. FOUR TIMES, boys. Check it out those AnandTech benchmark comparisons for yourself. Google this : iPad 4 GPU Performance Analyzed: PowerVR SGX 554MP4 Under the Hood

Topic.Title: AnandTech : Apple's new A6X processor gives the tegra 3 a Spanking.

Message.Msg: You pumper boys are wild-eyed hopeless dreamers. "Kepler will save us." "Icera will save us" "Tegra #5 will save us." "Project Denver ver. 9.0 will save us. "Our senseless cash hoard will save us." "Wayne might someday save us." "Intel's diminishing little hand-out will save us." "Cortex A-15 will save us." "The cloud will save us." "If it becomes fashionable to buy supercomputers, that could save us." "Our beta of 1.80 will save us." "Renaming the Tegra 3 to the Tegra TE might bamboozle buyers into saving us." "Blind faith in the Future might save us." Look. Apple just released their second processor chip of 2012. The Apple A6X. Which is FOUR TIMES (4x) faster than any tegra that nvidia has to offer today. FOUR TIMES (4x) faster, boys. Take a look at the AnandTech benchmark comparisons for yourself. Google this : iPad 4 GPU Performance Analyzed: PowerVR SGX 554MP4 Under the Hood So what are wannbe OEM tablet makers supposed to do? Sit on their hands waiting for nvidia to "Someday" catch-up with the far superior semiconductor design prowess of Apple? Never gonna happen, boys. The wanna-be tablet makers are done. And Jen's tegra chip folly is done too. "Apple does what Apple does and Nobody else is going to compete with them." -- Current nvidia CEO Jen Hsun Huang, MobileBeat, March 4, 2011.

Message.Title: Forbes : Intel might buy AMD's graphics unit? Wow!
Message.Msg: Forbes : Intel might buy AMD's graphics unit? Wow! That would transform the competitive landscape of the chip industry forever. Here's what Forbes' Eric Savitz wrote on Friday. "Graphics: He [UBS analyst Steve Eliscu] thinks the AMD graphics unit could be worth $2 billion or more to Intel. "If Intel made AMD-designed discrete graphics chips in its most advanced manufacturing facilities, Intel would potentially be able to create a much more profitable discrete graphics business than AMD has," he writes. "We would expect Intel to focus on the premium segment of the market, including the professional graphics business, which NVIDIA currently dominates." "Embedded processors, in particular for game consoles: “Market speculation suggests AMD has swept design wins in all of the three major console platforms – Microsoft, Nintendo and Sony, each of which would result in a either IP and/or silicon sales." Google it : AMD: Is Move Into ARM Chips Positioning It For Sale? - Forbes Eric Savitz So Best? If Intel Coporation were to buy part or all of AMD, how much might nvda stock plunge by on that industry transformational announcement -- which would change the competitve landscape of the semiconductor world forever?

Message.Title: Why did Mike Rayfield resign/let-go?
Message.Msg: Mike Rayfield's leave left an eerie feeling. Why did he resign or was let go? 1. Mismanagement: NVIDIA should have landed one of the following design wins: Kindle Fire HD or LG Nexus 4. Yes Nvidia scored Nexus 7 win. But failure to win a spot in Kindle Fire HD and LG Nexus 4 is a pretty serious flop, as the analysts widely expected a Kindle Fire HD win and LG traded S4 for T3 in Optimus Vu. LG Nexus 4 is a wonderful device at an incredible unlocked price and can operate on global networks without LTE support. Tegra 3 could be an ideal candidate for Nexus 4 with no supply constraints. 2. Historical finale: 2 years ago, S/A spread rumors that Mike Rayfield was out: "Why was a General Manager shown the door? ... Keep dropping the ball at critical points ... NVidia needs to take swift action. ... Please note that this is unlikely to affect anything until after the Tegra 3." Could this be a finale of the play? If NVIDIA can find a capable substitute, Rayfield’s departure could be a long-term positive. Short-tem pressure is building up quickly. If this is the closure of a historical play, NVIDIA is writing a new chapter in mobile history: Wayne, Project Boulder, Project Denver.

Topic.Title: AnandTech : Apple's new A6X processor gives the tegra 3 a Spanking.

Message.Msg: I don't consider myself a pumper. But I do believe the downside risk from here is limited. I'm bullish. That said, if they beat & raise again and the stock flies higher, I'll actually be looking to reduce my long position, since the stock seems to trade independent of the company's fundamentals.

Topic.Title: AnandTech : Apple's new A6X processor gives the tegra 3 a Spanking.

Message.Msg: thetrade50, you seem well, frightfully insecure. And unsettled and disconcerted and conflicted. Maybe rattled by all the bad nvidia news lately? First you write, "I'm bullish." Followed by, "I'll actually be looking to reduce my long position". You see the unsure, conflicted, vacilating uncertainty there? The rest of us sure do.

Topic.Title: AnandTech : Apple's new A6X processor gives the tegra 3 a Spanking.

Message.Msg: re-read what I wrote. I said I'll be looking to reduce my long position if the stock flies higher on another beat and raise. If they beat and raise and the stock stays flat or only moves a bit, I'll probably hold all positions and consider adding. If it goes lower, I'll almost certainly add to my position. I say "probably" and "almost certainly" since it'll all depend on what they actually report on how the stock reacts. But, as I said, I'm bullish, and think the stock is more likely to move higher than lower from here.
